name: advector
brief:
Traceable vector with differentiable subscript operations

Provides advector, a vector of adoubles that can trace subscripting
with adouble indices. This enables automatic differentiation through
array lookups where the index itself depends on independent variables.

**Key classes:**
- advector: Vector container with contiguous tape locations
- adubref: Reference type returned when indexing with adouble (lvalue case)

**Use case example:**
@code
advector table(n);        // Create table of adoubles
adouble index = ...;      // Index depends on independent variables
adouble result = table[index];  // Differentiation tracks index dependency
@endcode

@note This is only for taped (not tapeless) ADOL-C mode
see: adtb_types.h for adouble and pdouble definitions
